p: The granary weevil, Sitophilus granaries, is a cosmopolitan insect pest of storage facilities and processing plants. Sitophilus granarius causes damage to beans, corn, sorghum, nuts, oats, peanuts, rice, and wheat [ 30, 31]. This pest is controlled with synthetic insecticides, such as phosphine, which is highly efficacious against S. granarius. However, phosphine resistance has been reported in some populations of S. granarius [ 32].
